about: Running is just about the simplest form of exercise there is, and it's perfect for kids' seemingly endless energy and need for speed.
Get those feet up and off the ground with these easy exercises. Jumps build muscle strength, cardiovascular fitness, and endurance.
To make exercise more fun for kids, turn it into a game. Here are some ideas from Akpan.
Playing ball games indoors or outside can be great exercise for kids. Some of the benefits include aerobic exercise, balance, and coordination practice.
Skipping can be a fun form of aerobic activity that can also challenge skills such as balance and coordination.
Crab walk is a fun activity that also helps kids build their core and arm strength.
The bear crawl is walking on all fours with your belly facing the floor.This movement can be a good whole-body exercise that challenges kids to use their limbs and core.
Try forward, backward, and side lunges, as well as classic squats. Make it into a game by counting how many your child can do in 30-second intervals while keeping proper form.
Hit the floor for basic exercises that work the core: Sit-ups, push-ups, and planks. Kids can do traditional abdominal crunches, bicycle crunches, legs-up sit-ups, and more.
Yoga poses can be a fun and simple way for kids to exercise. A few easy and fun poses for kids to try include Tree Pose, Downward-Facing Dog, Upward-Facing Dog, Cobra, Child's Pose, and Happy Baby.
